36 static gboolean get_roi_values_from_conf( struct videoFormatTable_entry* videoFormat_entry , gboolean scalable , struct channelTable_entry *channel_entry){
37 
38  long roi_width;
39  long roi_height;
40  long roi_top;
41  long roi_left;
42  long roi_extent_bottom;
43  long roi_extent_right;
44 
45  /*
46  * If channel_entry is not NULL, this is a SU ROI so look for sink ROI parameters
47  */
48  if ( channel_entry ){
49 
50  if ( get_roi_parameters_for_sink (
51  channel_entry->channelIndex, scalable,
52  &roi_width, &roi_height,
53  &roi_top, &roi_left,
54  &roi_extent_bottom, &roi_extent_right ) ){
55 
56  /* if they are all set to 0 return FALSE so we don't lose time on settinf default values to vivoecrop and vivoeroi */
57  if ( ! (roi_width && roi_height && roi_top && roi_extent_bottom && roi_extent_right ))
58  return FALSE;
59 
60  /*
61  * save those parameters into the videoFormat_entry
62  */
63  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiHorzRes = roi_width;
64  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiVertRes = roi_height;
65  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiOriginTop = roi_top;
66  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiOriginLeft = roi_left;
67  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiExtentBottom = roi_extent_bottom;
68  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiExtentRight = roi_extent_right;
69 
70  return TRUE;
71 
72  }
73  else
74  return FALSE;
75 
76  }else{
77  /*
78  * If channel_entry is NULL, we are a SP ROI, so we look into configuration file for [source_x] groups
79  */
80 
81  if ( get_roi_parameters_for_sources (
82  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatIndex , scalable,
83  &roi_width, &roi_height,
84  &roi_top, &roi_left,
85  &roi_extent_bottom, &roi_extent_right ) ){
86 
87  /* if they are all set to 0 return FALSE so we don't lose time on settinf default values to vivoecrop and vivoeroi */
88  if ( ! (roi_width && roi_height && roi_top && roi_extent_bottom && roi_extent_right ))
89  return FALSE;
90 
91  /* copy the data in the videoFormat_entry */
92  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiHorzRes = roi_width;
93  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiVertRes = roi_height;
94  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiOriginTop = roi_top;
95  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiOriginLeft = roi_left;
96  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiExtentBottom = roi_extent_bottom;
97  videoFormat_entry->videoFormatRoiExtentRight = roi_extent_right;
98 
99  return TRUE;
100 
101  }
102  else
103  return FALSE;
104 
105  }
106 
107 }

115 static gboolean update_stream_data (gpointer stream_datas, struct videoFormatTable_entry * videoFormat_entry ) {
116 
117  /* get the stream_data from the channel */
118  stream_data *data = stream_datas;
119 
120  /* A structure to save the new detected caps */
121  GstStructure *video_caps;
122 
123  /*
124  * detect the new video caps
125  */
126 
127  video_caps = type_detection_for_roi( GST_BIN(data->pipeline) , data->udp_elem ) ;
128 
129  if ( !video_caps ){
130  g_critical ("Failed to adapt MPEG-4 pipeline for ROI");
131  return FALSE;
132  }
133 
134  /*
135  * fill rtp data and other mib parameters in needed
136  */
137  fill_entry(video_caps, videoFormat_entry , stream_datas);
138 
139  return TRUE;
140 
141 }

143 static gboolean handle_redirection_roi ( redirect_data *redirection ){
144 
145  g_debug("handle_redirection_roi()");
146 
147  /* first run a type find to get new caps in SU's pipeline before appsink */
148  GstElement *appsink = gst_bin_get_by_name ( GST_BIN(redirection->pipeline_SU) , APPSINK_NAME );
149  if ( !appsink ){
150  g_critical("Failed to retrieve %s in a redirection pipeline", APPSINK_NAME );
151  return FALSE;
152  }
153 
154  GstStructure *video_caps;
155  /*
156  * detect the new video caps
157  */
158  video_caps = type_detection_for_roi( GST_BIN(redirection->pipeline_SU) , appsink ) ;
159  if ( !video_caps ){
160  g_critical ("Failed to adapt MPEG-4 pipeline for ROI");
161  return FALSE;
162  }
163 
164  /* then pass them to the Service Provider's pipeline */
165 
166  /* Fisrt get appsrc element */
167  GstElement *appsrc = gst_bin_get_by_name ( GST_BIN(redirection->pipeline_SP) , APPSRC_NAME );
168  if ( !appsrc ){
169  g_critical("Failed to retrieve %s in a redirection pipeline", APPSRC_NAME );
170  return FALSE;
171  }
172 
173  GstCaps *caps = gst_caps_new_full( gst_structure_copy ( video_caps ) , NULL );
174  g_object_set ( appsrc , "caps" , caps , NULL) ;
175  video_caps = gst_caps_get_structure( caps, 0 );
176 
177  /* Get updsink element of SP pipeline */
178  GstElement *udpsink = gst_bin_get_by_name ( GST_BIN(redirection->pipeline_SP) , UDPSINK_NAME );
179 
180  if ( !udpsink ){
181  g_critical("Failed to retrieve %s in a redirection pipeline", UDPSINK_NAME );
182  return FALSE;
183  }
184 
185  /* Now run the typefind on the SP pipeline to update the caps for the SDP file */
186  video_caps = type_detection_for_roi( GST_BIN(redirection->pipeline_SP) , udpsink ) ;
187 
188  if ( !video_caps ){
189  g_critical ("Failed to adapt MPEG-4 pipeline for ROI");
190  return FALSE;
191  }
192 
193  /* get videoFormatEntry of SP */
194  struct videoFormatTable_entry *SP_videoFormat_entry = videoFormatTable_getEntry( redirection->video_SP_index );
195 
196  /*
197  * fill rtp data and other mib parameters in needed
198  */
199  fill_entry(video_caps, SP_videoFormat_entry , SP_videoFormat_entry->stream_datas);
200 
201  /*
202  * finally update the corresponding channel entry
203  */
204  struct channelTable_entry *SP_channel_entry = channelTable_get_from_VF_index( redirection->video_SP_index );
205  channelTable_fill_entry ( SP_channel_entry , SP_videoFormat_entry );
206 
207  return TRUE;
208 
209 }
210 
216 GstElement *get_element_from_bin( GstElement *pipeline , GType type){
217 
218  GstIterator *iter = NULL;
219  gboolean done;
220 
221  iter = gst_bin_iterate_recurse (GST_BIN ( pipeline ));
222 
223  done = FALSE;
224  while (!done)
225  {
226 
227  GValue item = G_VALUE_INIT;
228 
229  switch (gst_iterator_next (iter, &item)) {
230  case GST_ITERATOR_OK:
231  if (G_TYPE_CHECK_INSTANCE_TYPE(g_value_get_object (&item), type))
232  return GST_ELEMENT(g_value_get_object (&item));
233  else
234  break;
235  case GST_ITERATOR_RESYNC:
236  // We don't rollback anything, we just ignore already processed ones
237  gst_iterator_resync (iter);
238  break;
239  case GST_ITERATOR_ERROR:
240  g_critical("while iteratin through gst_source bin");
241  done = TRUE;
242  break;
243  case GST_ITERATOR_DONE:
244  done = TRUE;
245  break;
246  }
247  }
248 
249  gst_iterator_free (iter);
250 
251  return NULL;
252 
253 }
254 
255 static gboolean
256 set_parameters_to_roi_elements ( struct videoFormatTable_entry *video_stream_info , GstElement *vivoecrop, GstElement *vivoecaps, gboolean scalable ){
257 
258  /* Set the parameters to crop element */
259  gst_vivoe_crop_update (G_OBJECT ( vivoecrop ), video_stream_info , scalable );
260 
261  if ( scalable ){
262 
263  /*
264  * Set parameters to roi element
265  * As we are after a scaling element we can built a caps that is a RAW video
266  */
267  GstPad *vivoecrop_src_pad = gst_element_get_static_pad( vivoecrop , "src");
268  GstCaps *new_caps;
269  if ( vivoecrop_src_pad)
270  new_caps = gst_caps_copy (gst_pad_get_pad_template_caps (vivoecrop_src_pad));
271  else{
272  g_critical("Faile to get vivoecrop source pad template");
273  return FALSE;
274  }
275 
276  gst_caps_set_simple ( new_caps ,
277  "height" , G_TYPE_INT , video_stream_info->videoFormatRoiVertRes ,
278  "width" , G_TYPE_INT , video_stream_info->videoFormatRoiHorzRes ,
279  NULL);
280 
281  /* set the caps to the capsfilter */
282  g_object_set ( G_OBJECT ( vivoecaps ) ,
283  "caps" , new_caps ,
284  NULL
285  );
286 
287  GstCaps *new_caps_bis;
288  g_object_get ( G_OBJECT( vivoecaps ) , "caps" , &new_caps_bis , NULL ) ;
289 
290  }
291 
292  return TRUE ;
293 
294 }
295 
304 gboolean handle_roi( GstElement *pipeline, struct videoFormatTable_entry *video_stream_info , struct channelTable_entry *channel_entry ) {
305 
306  GstElement *vivoecrop = NULL;
307  GstElement *vivoecaps = NULL;
308  gboolean scalable = FALSE ;
309 
310  g_debug("handle_roi()");
311 
312  /*
313  * iterates though the bin source to find the element vivoecrop
314  */
315  vivoecrop = get_element_from_bin( pipeline, GST_TYPE_VIVOE_CROP );
316  if ( !vivoecrop ){
317  g_debug("This is a not ROI channel");
318  /*
319  * then this is not a ROI channel , set the type to videoChannel and exit function */
320  video_stream_info->videoFormatType = videoChannel ;
321  return FALSE;
322  }
323 
324  g_debug("This is a ROI channel");
325 
326  /*
327  * If we get here, it means that the element vivoecrop has been found in the pipeline, so this videoFormat is a roi
328  */
329  video_stream_info->videoFormatType = roi;
330 
331  /*
332  * Check if roi is scalable
333  */
334  /*
335  * iterates though the bin source to find the element vivoecaps
336  */
337  vivoecaps = get_element_from_bin( pipeline, GST_TYPE_VIVOE_CAPS );
338  if ( vivoecaps )
339  scalable = TRUE ;
340  /*
341  * then the ROI is scalable
342  */
343 
344  /*
345  * Set the ROI parameter into the videoFormat Entry
346  * This will initialize the ROI parameters to 0 if they were not specified in the configuration file
347  */
348  if ( get_roi_values_from_conf( video_stream_info, scalable , channel_entry ) ){
349  set_parameters_to_roi_elements ( video_stream_info , vivoecrop, vivoecaps , scalable );
350  return TRUE;
351  }
352  else
353  return TRUE;
354 
355 }
356 
363 gboolean update_pipeline_on_roi_changes( gpointer stream_datas , struct channelTable_entry *channel_entry , struct videoFormatTable_entry *videoFormat_entry){
364 
365  stream_data *data = stream_datas;
366  GstElement *pipeline = data->pipeline;
367  gboolean scalable = FALSE;
368 
369  /* check if this is a redirection */
370  redirect_data *redirection = SU_is_redirection(channel_entry->channelIndex);
371 
372 
373  /*
374  * return if the stream data or pipeline have not been initialize
375  */
376  if ( !data || !pipeline )
377  return FALSE;
378 
379  /*
380  * The values in the table should already been updated. Here we just handle the pipeline here.
381  * We should not chceck the values entered by the user. As an example, this is not where we should
382  * check that the ROI want from non-scalable to scalable.
383  */
384  GstElement *vivoecrop = get_element_from_bin( pipeline , GST_TYPE_VIVOE_CROP );
385  GstElement *vivoecaps = get_element_from_bin( pipeline , GST_TYPE_VIVOE_CAPS );
386 
387  if ( !vivoecrop)
388  return FALSE;
389 
390  if ( vivoecaps )
391  scalable = TRUE ;
392 
393  set_parameters_to_roi_elements ( videoFormat_entry , vivoecrop, vivoecaps, scalable );
394 
395  if ( (! strcmp( channel_entry->channelVideoFormat , MPEG4_NAME )) && channel_entry->channelType != serviceUser && redirection == NULL ){
396  /*
397  * call handle MPEG4 config update
398  */
399  if ( !update_stream_data (stream_datas, videoFormat_entry ))
400  return FALSE;
401  }
402 
403  if ( redirection ){
404  if (redirection->roi_presence ){
405  if ( ! handle_redirection_roi ( redirection )){
406  return FALSE;
407  }
408  }
409  }
410 
411  return TRUE;
412 
413 }
414 
421  static gchar* camera_ctl_printf( gchar *camera_ctl , struct channelTable_entry *channel_entry ){
422 
423  /* parse the command line to find the correspondance to the channel entry parameters */
424  gchar *parse = strchr( (const char*) camera_ctl , '%' );
425  gchar *previous_parse = camera_ctl;
426  gchar *return_string = (gchar*) malloc( sizeof(gchar) * (strlen(camera_ctl) + 50 ) );
427  /*
428  * The memory allocated for the returned string should be greater than the original string and here's why:
429  * each time a %a or %b or %c or %d will be found its value will be replaced by its numerical correspondance according to
430  * the values of the channel's parameters. When this parameters worth 100 or 1000 or 1000, the characters %a will be replaced
431  * by 100, 1000, 10000. Thus this add to the string 3, 4 or 5 characters when only 2 characers are replaced: '%' and 'a'.
432  * Thus we need to allocated more memory than the original string size. 50 more bytes should be large enough. Howver, this is a quick
433  * fix, but it is not optimal. A optimal solution would be to realloc return_string each time the we print more than two characters into it
434  */
435  gchar *return_string_head = return_string;
436  gboolean end_string = FALSE;
437  int wrote;
438 
439  while ( parse != NULL && end_string == FALSE ){
440  switch ( *(parse + 1) ){
441  case 'a':
442  strncpy( return_string , previous_parse , strlen (previous_parse) - strlen ( parse ) );
443  return_string += strlen ( previous_parse ) - strlen ( parse );
444  wrote = sprintf(return_string , "%ld", channel_entry->channelRoiOriginTop);
445  return_string += wrote;
446  parse += 2;
447  break;
448  case 'b':
449  strncpy( return_string , previous_parse , strlen (previous_parse) - strlen ( parse ) );
450  return_string += strlen ( previous_parse ) - strlen ( parse );
451  wrote = sprintf(return_string , "%ld", channel_entry->channelRoiOriginLeft);
452  return_string += wrote;
453  parse += 2;
454  break;
455  case 'c':
456  strncpy( return_string , previous_parse , strlen (previous_parse) - strlen ( parse ) );
457  return_string += strlen ( previous_parse ) - strlen ( parse );
458  wrote = sprintf(return_string , "%ld", channel_entry->channelRoiExtentBottom);
459  return_string += wrote;
460  parse += 2;
461  break;
462  case 'd':
463  strncpy( return_string , previous_parse , strlen (previous_parse) - strlen ( parse ) );
464  return_string += strlen ( previous_parse ) - strlen ( parse );
465  wrote = sprintf(return_string , "%ld", channel_entry->channelRoiExtentRight);
466  return_string += wrote;
467  parse += 2;
468  break;
469  default:
470  strncpy(return_string, previous_parse , strlen (previous_parse) - strlen ( parse ) + 1);
471  return_string += strlen ( previous_parse ) - strlen ( parse ) + 1;
472  parse++;
473  break;
474  }
475  previous_parse = parse;
476  parse = strchr( (const char*) parse , '%' );
477  }
478 
479  /* terminate string properly */
480  strncpy ( return_string, "\0", 1 );
481 
482  return return_string_head;
483 
484 }

490 gboolean update_camera_ctl_on_roi_changes ( struct channelTable_entry *channel_entry )
491 {
492  int ret = 0;
493 
494  /* first retrieve the command line to use to control the camera and its arguments */
495  gchar *camera_ctl = get_camera_ctl_cmdline ( channel_entry->channelVideoFormatIndex ) ;
496 
497  if ( !camera_ctl ){
498  return FALSE;
499  }
500 
501  gchar *command_line = camera_ctl_printf( camera_ctl , channel_entry );
502 
503  /* execute command */
504  ret = system(command_line);
505 
506  /* check the returned value of the command execution */
507  if ( ret < 0 )
508  {
509  g_critical("Failed to launch a the command to controle camera of source_%ld: %s", channel_entry->channelVideoFormatIndex , strerror(errno));
510  return FALSE;
511  }
512 
513  /* command_line is a newly allocated string where memory have been allocated in camera_ctl_printf(), we need to free it */
514  free ( command_line );
515 
516  return TRUE;
517 
518 }
